Goscinny and Uderzo previously had success with their series ''[[Oumpah-pah]]'', which was published in the [[Tintin (magazine)|''Tintin'']] magazine. ''AstÃ©rix'' was originally serialised in the magazine ''[[Pilote]]'', in the very first issue published on [[October 29]], [[1959]].<ref name="Pilote-1959">{{cite web | last =BDoubliÃ©es | title =Pilote annÃ©e 1959 | url =http://bdoubliees.com/journalpilote/series1/asterix.htm | language = French }}</ref> In 1961 the first book was put together entitled ''[[Asterix the Gaul]]''. From then on, books were released generally on a yearly basis. When Goscinny died, Uderzo continued the series alone, though on a less frequent basis. Uderzo's stories have not been as critically well received as the ones co-authored with Goscinny.{{Fact|date=February 2007}}
Goscinny and Uderzo previously had success with their series ''[[Oumpah-pah]]'', which was published in the [[Tintin (magazine)|''Tintin'']] magazine. ''AstÃ©rix'' was originally serialised in the magazine ''[[Pilote]]'', in the very first issue published on [[October 29]], [[1959]].<ref name="Pilote-1959">{{cite web | last =BDoubliÃ©es | title =Pilote annÃ©e 1959 | url =http://bdoubliees.com/journalpilote/series1/asterix.htm | language = French }}</ref> In 1961 the first book was put together entitled ''[[Asterix the Gaul]]''. From then on, books were released generally on a yearly basis. When Goscinny died, Uderzo continued the series alone, though on a less frequent basis. Uderzo's stories have not been as critically well received as the ones co-authored with Goscinny.{{Fact|date=February 2007}}
